dataset.title: This is a Kuparuk River rock- scrubbing, Arctic LTER 1990.

abstract.para: This is a Kuparuk River rock- scrubbing. The insects are baetis. The file simply lists the length of each insect measured, as well as when and where along the river it was captured. Only the actual measurements of the insects are listed, for example, if there wasn't a particular insect found from a replicate at a station, then that station isn't listed either. This file is for baetis.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications

A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:
Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Approximately 1km upstream and 2 km downstream of where the Dalton Highway crosses the Kuparuk River in arctic Alaska.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: Jul91 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Julie Pallant DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Julie Pallant DATE: 1Oct91

para.literalLayout: A rock-scrubbing technique was used to collect samples at eight different stations (-1000m, -500m, -400m, -100m, 1000m, 1400m, 2000m, and 2500m), with two replicates at each bottom scrub station, on three different dates. The same sampling procedure was used for each date. The stations were measured relative to the site of the dripper. The samples were preserved in ethanol then picked, sorted, counted, and measured in Duluth using a digitizing pad.

Variable descrip. Precis./Units Coded Missing (Y/N) Values SITE Kuparuk River Y DATE Date DDMMMYY n STATION Distance from new dripper meters n TRIAL Repetition number 1 or 2 n LENGTH Length of individual bug mm n COMMENTS Notes about data blank (12) CALCULATIONS Variable Formula
